Sentencas: Exceptional properties such as dielectric, ferroelectric, piezoelectric, magnetic, catalytic, and photovoltaic of perovskite materials open new doors to many groundbreaking discoveries for unique device ideas.
Titulo: Engineering the band gap of LaCrO3 doping with transition metals (Co, Pd, and Ir)

Sentencas: These materials properties are inherited from their crystal structures; therefore, the features can be tuned via varying details of the crystal structures.
Titulo: Engineering the band gap of LaCrO3 doping with transition metals (Co, Pd, and Ir)

Sentencas: In the literature, LaCrO3 (LCO) is one those mostly examined perovskites for various purposes such as solid oxide fuel cells, catalytic converters, and sensors.
Titulo: Engineering the band gap of LaCrO3 doping with transition metals (Co, Pd, and Ir)

Sentencas: In the present study, the band gap tuning of LCO was investigated via doping a transition element such as cobalt (Co), palladium (Pd), and iridium (Ir) into Cr atom.
Titulo: Engineering the band gap of LaCrO3 doping with transition metals (Co, Pd, and Ir)

Sentencas: The synthesized doped and un-doped LCO powders were characterized by infrared spectra (IR) and X-ray diffraction (XRD).
Titulo: Engineering the band gap of LaCrO3 doping with transition metals (Co, Pd, and Ir)

Sentencas: Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) was employed to study the surface topography of LCO and doped LCO thin films on silicon substrates.
Titulo: Engineering the band gap of LaCrO3 doping with transition metals (Co, Pd, and Ir)

Sentencas: The band gaps of the LCO and doped LCO films were scrutinized using a UV-Vis spectrometer.
Titulo: Engineering the band gap of LaCrO3 doping with transition metals (Co, Pd, and Ir)

Sentencas: Our study has shown that the band gap of LCO was successfully lowered from 3.4 eV to 2.66 eV and can be engineered via substitution at various mol% of transition elements (Co, Pd, Ir) onto B-site Cr atom in the LCO perovskite structure.
Titulo: Engineering the band gap of LaCrO3 doping with transition metals (Co, Pd, and Ir)
